issue.title: `enable_nonlocking_formatter_optimization` should be disabled for container adaptors

discussion.p: As the standard currently defines formatters for `queue`, `prioriy_queue`, and `stack` `enable_nonlocking_formatter_optimization` is specialized to `true` for these adaptors per p3:

blockquote.p: Unless specified otherwise, for each type `T` for which a formatter specialization is provided by the library, each of the headers provides the following specialization:

discussion.p:
However, formatting an adaptor requires formatting of the underlying range, and we disable the nonlocking_optimizations for all ranges.
This problem does not occur for the `flat_set`, `flat_map` adaptors, which are also ranges, and do not have a specialized formatter.
The proposed wording has recently been implemented in gcc's libstdc++.
